/*
 * [537] Complex Number Multiplication
 *
 * https://leetcode.com/problems/complex-number-multiplication/description/
 *
 * algorithms
 * Medium (63.64%)
 * Total Accepted:    22.8K
 * Total Submissions: 35.8K
 * Testcase Example:  '"1+1i"\n"1+1i"'
 *
 * 
 * Given two strings representing two complex numbers.
 * 
 * 
 * You need to return a string representing their multiplication. Note i2 = -1
 * according to the definition.
 * 
 * 
 * Example 1:
 * 
 * Input: "1+1i", "1+1i"
 * Output: "0+2i"
 * Explanation: (1 + i) * (1 + i) = 1 + i2 + 2 * i = 2i, and you need convert
 * it to the form of 0+2i.
 * 
 * 
 * 
 * Example 2:
 * 
 * Input: "1+-1i", "1+-1i"
 * Output: "0+-2i"
 * Explanation: (1 - i) * (1 - i) = 1 + i2 - 2 * i = -2i, and you need convert
 * it to the form of 0+-2i.
 * 
 * 
 * 
 * Note:
 * 
 * The input strings will not have extra blank.
 * The input strings will be given in the form of a+bi, where the integer a and
 * b will both belong to the range of [-100, 100]. And the output should be
 * also in this form.
 * 
 * 
 */
class Solution {
    public String complexNumberMultiply(String a, String b) {
        String[] str1 = a.split("\\+|i"); //+需要转义\+
        String[] str2 = b.split("\\+|i");
        int x1 = Integer.parseInt(str1[0]);
        int y1 = Integer.parseInt(str1[1]);
        int x2 = Integer.parseInt(str2[0]);
        int y2 = Integer.parseInt(str2[1]);
        return (x1*x2 - y1*y2) + "+" +(x2*y1 + x1*y2) + "i";
    }
}
